title: Windows KernelStream Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists when the Windows KernelStream improperly handles objects in memory. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could obtain information to further compromise the user’s system.

title: Windows Graphics Component Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
description: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.

title: Windows Port Class Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
description: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.

title: Windows KernelStream Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is memory layout - the vulnerability allows an attacker to collect information that facilitates predicting addressing of the memory.

title: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft Exchange Server Autodiscover Server Side Request Forgery Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Microsoft Exchange Server. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
timeline: 07/04/2021 – Reported through Pwn2Own and duplicate with Orange Tsai

title: Microsoft Exchange Server PowerShell Improper Authentication Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Microsoft Exchange Server. Although authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, the existing authentication mechanism can be bypassed.
timeline: 07/04/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor through Pwn2Own and duplicate with Orange Tsai

title: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft Exchange Server OAB Arbitrary File Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Microsoft Exchange Server. Although authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, the existing authentication mechanism can be bypassed.
timeline: 07/04/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
22/07/2021 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

version: Insight - Asset Management app: All 5.x to 8x versions before 8.9.3
title: Remote Code Execution through Insight - Asset Management
description: nsight - Asset Management has a feature to import data from several databases (DBs). One of these DBs, the H2 DB, has a native function in its library which an attacker can use to run code on the server (remote code execution a.k.a. RCE). The H2 DB is bundled with Jira to help speed up the setup of Jira test environments.
timeline: 31/05/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
20/10/2021 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: Arbitrary file read on Weblogic Server via T3 Protocol
description: Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0 and 12.2.1.4.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via IIOP, T3 attack Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in Arbitrary file read on Oracle WebLogic Server.
timeline: 06/10/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
24/10/2021 – Vendor accepted

title: win32k direct composition Information disclosure
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists when the win32k component improperly provides kernel information. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could obtain information to further compromise the user’s system.
timeline: 2021-08-28 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
2021-09-22 – The vendor accepted the report
2022-01-12 -  The vendor publish the patch

title: Apache Druid XSS Vulnerability
description: In apache druid version version 0.22.0 XSS vulnerability exists that allows attackers to steal victim's login session.
timeline: 15/11/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
23/11/2021 – The vendor accepted the report

title: Apache NiFi information disclosure by XXE in TransformXML
description: In the TransformXML processor, an authenticated user could configure an XSLT file which, if it included malicious external entity calls, may reveal sensitive information.
solution: The 'Secure processing' property will now apply to the configured XSLT file as well as flow files being transformed. Users running any previous NiFi release should upgrade to the latest release.
timeline: 19/11/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
15/12/2021 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 (on premises) Information Disclosure
description: Microsoft Dynamics (on premises) 365 allows arbitrary loading of reports. This results in information disclosure when the victim clicks on an URL pointing to a specially crafted one by an attacker
timeline: 13/01/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
13/10/2021 – The vendor accepted the report
14/01/2022 - Vendor fixed the issue, did not provide an advisory but acknowledged the report in 12/2021

title: Use after free in PDFium
description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Google Chrome. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.
timeline: 24/10/2018 - Vulnerability reported to vendor

title: NOPE
description: The fix for bug CVE-2020-9484 introduced a time of check, time of use vulnerability into Apache Tomcat 10.1.0-M1 to 10.1.0-M8, 10.0.0-M5 to 10.0.14, 9.0.35 to 9.0.56 and 8.5.55 to 8.5.73 that allowed a local attacker to perform actions with the privileges of the user that the Tomcat process is using. This issue is only exploitable when Tomcat is configured to persist sessions using the FileStore.
timeline: 17/12/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
04/01/2021 – The vendor accepted the report
27/01/2022 – Disclosure

title: CVE-2021-37941 Elastic APM Java Agent Local Privilege Escalation
description: A local privilege escalation issue was found with the APM Java agent, where a user on the system could attach a malicious file to an application running with the APM Java agent. Using this vector, a malicious or compromised user account could use the agent to run commands at a higher level of permissions than they possess.
solution: Update to 1.27.0 or newer or use the unaffected -javaagent-based installation method 5 and disable the profiling_inferred_spans_enabled 9 option.
timeline: 17/10/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
19/11/2021 – Disclose

title: CVE-2021-37942 Elastic APM Java Agent  Local Privilege Escalation
description: A local privilege escalation issue was found with the APM Java agent, where a user on the system could attach a malicious plugin to an application running the APM Java agent. By using this vulnerability, an attacker could execute code at a potentially higher level of permissions than their user typically has access to.
timeline: 17/10/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
10/12/2021 – Disclose

title: Dynamics GP Elevation of Privilege
description: Dynamics GP 2018's Rich client allows regular users to perform arbitrary SQL DML via file upload. This SQLi is only exploitable when emailing for workflow and email multi-factor authentication is enabled.
timeline: 10/26/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor

title: Dynamics GP 2018 Remote Code Execution
description: Dynamics GP 2018 Web Service handled the document id parameter incorrectly during invoice creation, allowing users to inject SQL and write arbitrary data into the database. This was then used to plant a serialized object to be processed later, resulting in code execution.
timeline: 8/2/2022 - Vendor fixed the issue and published an advisory

title: Json unsafe deserialize - new gadget
description: FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.10.4 mishandles the interaction between serialization gadgets and typing, related to org.springframework.aop.config.MethodLocatingFactoryBean (aka spring-aop)
timeline: 2020-04-01 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
07/04/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: Multiple privilege escalation on Oracle BI
description: CVE-2021-2013, CVE-2021-2049, CVE-2021-2050, CVE-2021-2051. Vulnerability in the Oracle BI Publisher product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: BI Publisher Security). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.0.0.0, 11.1.1.9.0, 12.2.1.3.0 and 12.2.1.4.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle BI Publisher. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle BI Publisher accessible data as well as unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of Oracle BI Publisher accessible data and unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of Oracle BI Publisher
timeline: 2020-09-05 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
15/10/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: XXE on Oracle BI - CVE-2020-14880
description: Vulnerability in the BI Publisher product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: E-Business Suite - XDO). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.0.0.0, 11.1.1.9.0, 12.2.1.3.0 and 12.2.1.4.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise BI Publisher. While the vulnerability is in BI Publisher, attacks may significantly impact additional products. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all BI Publisher accessible data as well as unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of BI Publisher accessible data
timeline: 2020-08-05 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
07/09/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: XXE on Oracle BI - CVE-2020-14879
description: Vulnerability in the BI Publisher product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: E-Business Suite - XDO). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.0.0.0, 11.1.1.9.0, 12.2.1.3.0 and 12.2.1.4.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise BI Publisher. While the vulnerability is in BI Publisher, attacks may significantly impact additional products. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all BI Publisher accessible data as well as unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of BI Publisher accessible data
timeline: 2020-08-05 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
07/09/2020 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: Zip-slip mitigation bypass in Spring Integration Zip extension
description: spring-integration-zip , versions prior to 1.0.4, exposes an arbitrary file write vulnerability, that can be achieved using a specially crafted zip archive (affects other archives as well, bzip2, tar, xz, war, cpio, 7z), that holds path traversal filenames. So when the filename gets concatenated to the target extraction directory, the final path ends up outside of the target folder. The previous cve-2018-1263 prevented the framework from unzipping general traversal file names. The special file names, containing a working directory for unzipping, still can slip out of that working directory. This specifically applies to the unzip transformer. This can only happen if an application using this library accepts and unpacks zip files from untrusted sources.
timeline: 28/01/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
28/01/2021 – Fix updated
26/02/2021 – Initial vulnerability report published.

title: Unsafe deserialization migitagion bypass
description: The fix for CVE-2020-9484 was incomplete. When using Apache Tomcat 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0, 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.41, 8.5.0 to 8.5.61 or 7.0.0. to 7.0.107 with a configuration edge case that was highly unlikely to be used, the Tomcat instance was still vulnerable to CVE-2020-9494. Note that both the previously published prerequisites for CVE-2020-9484 and the previously published mitigations for CVE-2020-9484 also apply to this issue.
timeline: 20/01/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
02/02/2021 – Vulnerability report published

title: Remote Command Injection on Akuvox

title: Local Privilege Escalation within Spring Webflux Multipart Request Handling
description: In Spring Framework, versions 5.2.x prior to 5.2.15 and versions 5.3.x prior to 5.3.7, a WebFlux application is vulnerable to a privilege escalation: by (re)creating the temporary storage directory, a locally authenticated malicious user can read or modify files that have been uploaded to the WebFlux application, or overwrite arbitrary files with multipart request data.
solution: Users of affected versions should apply the following mitigation. 5.3.x users should upgrade to 5.3.7. 5.2.x users should upgrade to 5.2.15. No other steps are necessary. Releases that have fixed this issue include:
timeline: 30/04/2021 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor

timeline: 2019 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
06/06/2019 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

version: Zimbra Collaboration Server before 8.7.11 P9, 8.8.9 P8, 8.8.10 P4 and 8.8.11
title: XXE on Zimbra ZxChat component
description: ZxChat (aka ZeXtras Chat), as used for zimbra-chat and zimbra-talk in Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite 8.7 and 8.8 and in other products, allows XXE attacks, as demonstrated by a crafted XML request to mailboxd.
timeline: 2018 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
29/05/2019 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: RCE on LimeSurvey
description: LimeSurvey 2.6.x before 2.6.7, 2.7x.x before 2.73.1, and 3.x before 3.4.2 mishandles application/controller/InstallerController.php after installation, which allows remote attackers to access the configuration file.
timeline: 2018 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
23/02/2018 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Header Bypass Vulnerability
description: A vulnerability in the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) scanner of Cisco AsyncOS Software for Cisco Email Security Appliances (ESA) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to bypass configured user filters on the device. The vulnerability is due to improper error handling of a malformed MIME header in an email attachment. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending an email with a crafted MIME attachment. For example, a successful exploit could allow the attacker to bypass configured user filters to drop the email. The malformed MIME headers may not be RFC compliant. However, some mail clients could still allow users to access the attachment, which may not have been properly filtered by the device. Cisco Bug IDs: CSCvf44666.
timeline: 2017 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
29/11/2017 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch

version: Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX before R2 2017 SP1 and Sitefinity before 10.0.6412.0
title: RCE in Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX
description: Telerik.Web.UI.dll in Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX before R2 2017 SP1 and Sitefinity before 10.0.6412.0 does not properly protect Telerik.Web.UI.DialogParametersEncryptionKey or the MachineKey, which makes it easier for remote attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms, leading to a MachineKey leak, arbitrary file uploads or downloads, XSS, or ASP.NET ViewState compromise.
timeline: 06/06/2017: Discovered the vulnerability.
13/06/2017: Reported to Progress.
03/07/2017: Security advisory released.

title: VCSA-2
RCE on Apache Struts
description: Apache Struts 2.x before 2.3.24.1 allows remote attackers to manipulate Struts internals, alter user sessions, or affect container settings via vectors involving a top object.
timeline: 20/03/2015 – Reported the vulnerability to the vendor
01/07/2015 – The vendor accepted the report and publish the patch
